user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_socket_noninheritable_:
```c
int
MHD_socket_noninheritable_ (MHD_socket sock)
{
#if defined(MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS)
  int flags;

  flags = fcntl (sock,
                 F_GETFD);
  if (-1 == flags)
    return 0;

  if ( ((flags | FD_CLOEXEC) != flags) &&
       (0 != fcntl (sock,
                    F_SETFD,
                    flags | FD_CLOEXEC)) )
    return 0;
#elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  if (! SetHandleInformation ((HANDLE) sock,
                              HANDLE_FLAG_INHERIT,
                              0))
    return 0;
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#if defined(MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS)
  int flags;

  flags = fcntl (sock,
                 F_GETFD);
  if (-1 == flags)
    return 0;

  if ( ((flags | FD_CLOEXEC) != flags) &&
       (0 != fcntl (sock,
                    F_SETFD,
                    flags | FD_CLOEXEC)) )
    return 0;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. All statements in the fragment are potentially reachable: after retrieving flags with fcntl(F_GETFD) the function returns immediately only when flags == -1. Otherwise control proceeds to the conditional that uses short-circuit && — the second fcntl(F_SETFD, ...) is executed only when ((flags | FD_CLOEXEC) != flags) is true, and the subsequent return 0 is executed only if that fcntl call returns non-zero. If neither error case occurs control falls through to the final return (!0). The preprocessor guards only select whether this POSIX branch is compiled; that conditional compilation does not create unreachable code within the compiled branch.
